commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hm? Where did Setsuna go?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Oh, she said she was going to take a break and left just now.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: She didn't seem to be acting like someone going on a break, though.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hmm. I thought she'd gotten her groove back when we got together the other day, but it looks like it's still weighing on her mind.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Shioriko Mifune has really been upping the intensity of her campaign these days, after all.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: She visited all the first-year classrooms today! Apparently, she appears all around the place when break time rolls by!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: We've been trying to casually cheer up Setsuna too, but it hasn't been going well.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah, that's right. Maybe Setsuna will feel better if you lend her an ear.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll go look for her. Everyone else, continue with practice!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I must win. I don't want to be the reason why the club is abolished.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Huff* *Huff* I found you, Setsuna!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Oh? What's the matter?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I should be asking you the same thing. I came looking for you since you suddenly left practice and that got me worried.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Oh, I'm sorry. Um, I just went to go buy a drink along with my break.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You came to the rooftop to buy a drink?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Oh, uh...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Listen, Setsuna. It can't be helped that you're worried about the re-election, but I want you to talk to me about it rather than carry the burden all on your own.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I-I'm sorry. Um, I'll go back to practice right away.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Please. I want to think about it together with you. I want you to let me wrack my brains. Everyone in the club feels the same way as well, you know?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But... I could see how much work the School Idol Festival preparations would require at our last gathering.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Which is why I figured it wouldn't be right for me to burden all of you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Not at all! It would be more unbearable for us to not be able to help you. That's why I'm begging you to talk to me.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Thank you very much. Then, is it okay if I just talk to you?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Of course!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What made you decide to become the student council president?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Well, um...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Is it because you want to make the whole school better?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I'm sorry. I don't have any particularly strong feelings behind my reasons for becoming the student council president.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: The biggest motive was following what my parents told me to do.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I was brought up being told that they wanted me to become someone who was proactive and took on leadership roles.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I figured I could be the person my parents wanted me to be if I became the student council president. That's why I did the same thing in elementary and middle school.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So you're not the student council president because you enjoy the role?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Oh, no, that's not what I meant.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I really do feel a sense of accomplishment, and because I've been doing it since I was a child, it has become a part of my life.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Also, my parents don't nag me when I'm the student council president.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: But I'm sure they'd be stricter about my curfew and I wouldn't be able to set aside any time for my school idol activities if I lost the student council presidency.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That would be troublesome.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I really must win the re-election.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Right, and we'll all cheer for you. First thing's first, everyone needs to know what exactly it is that you're striving for.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Mifune's posters stated that she would run the school in a way to suit the needs of every single student. What kind of school do you want to create, Setsuna?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: What? Uhhh, well...

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I've always thought that being the student council president was a behind-the-scenes job.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I've always carried out my role by creating a comfortable environment for all the students who attend the school.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: So... What I'm trying to say is... Um, the school I'm striving to create is one that is comfortable for...everyone?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I think your ideal school is really great, Setsuna. It means you'll support us so that we can do what we want, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But I don't think what Mifune's saying is wrong either. It'd be good if you could come up with something to really make yourself stand out.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Ack, you're right.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I know! How about we ask Eli and Dia how they go about things?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: What do I do as student council president?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Let me think. I'm careful about listening to every single opinion, no matter how small it may be. I think the average student sees the president as strict and intimidating.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: So I try to keep my door open as wide as possible.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: I see. So that's why you would like some advice about what you should do as student council president.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: The first thing I do is let the students talk it out themselves as there is a possibility of the students losing their independence if the student council resolves everything.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: As such...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I see...

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: The aspect they both share is the strong communication they maintain with the students. I've tried to keep my ear out for everyone by setting up a suggestion box, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's right. When Kasumi and I went to the student council room for the first time, you listened to everything we had to say, so I don't think you're wrong in that respect.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I'll try pushing my approachability to the students by doing things like placing more suggestion boxes around the school.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We'll all help you place them around. Let's get started on making them once practice is over!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Great, thank you very much!
